channel.title: Getting an error when i run a server
channel.description:
i get this error when i run any server including my own
C:/Documents and settings/b/desktop/client>java -Xmx500m -jar updater/client.jar 'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.

item.title: Getting an error when i run a server

item.description:
@Teh_Moose wrote:

What version did you download?

item.source: Getting an error when i run a server

item.title: Getting an error when i run a server
item.dc:creator: @Teh_Moose Teh Moose
item.description:
@Teh_Moose wrote:

Ok, go in my computer, right click and do properties, then do advanced system settings and go in environment variables. From there locate your file named “CLASSPATH” go in it. then insert your correct version of jdk. If you don’t have anything about jdk in your classpath check this to help you on the basics of setting up environment variabes and your server http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,285415.0.html
All credit for the tut link above to stormcutter

Read full topic
item.source: Getting an error when i run a server

item.title: Getting an error when i run a server
item.dc:creator: @LeechYourStuffPlease LeechYourStuffPlease
item.description:
@LeechYourStuffPlease wrote:

Heres my Run.bat

@echo off color 0a title Server Scape java -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server
Try that.
Or If that does not work tell me what you Run.bat says
A run.bat is the file that you click to run the server
To see whats in your run.bat
Right click-it and copy and paste what it says.
Edit: Fixing what surrounds in the code spot

Read full topic
